quoteLast: and were inside the entrance by 11:40. How well we seemed to know the place! I knew exactly where the beastly field guns at the mouth would open fire and exactly when they would cease--as we pushed in, and so if their shots went over us they would land on the opposite bank among their own troops. Very soon came the soft whistle of the shell, then again and again--but we were nearing the entrance and they turned on the _Mersey_.
title: The British Navy in Battle
author: Pollen, Arthur Joseph Hungerford, 1866-1937
